TechnologyHow Metis Overcomes a Major SEC Obstacle through Decentralized SequencersSEC Commissioner Hester Peirce recently gave a clear signal: chains that operate with centralized matching engines could face regulation as exchanges.â"If you have a matching engine thatâs controlled by one entity that controls all the pieces of that, then that looks a lot more like an exchange.â Itâs a warning that cuts to the heart of how many chains are run today. While they promise decentralization and scale, many rely on a single sequencer to control the flow of transactions. This creates a bottleneck that weakens censorship resistance, erodes trust, and raises new regulatory concerns.Metis planned ahead and made a different choice. We built the first live Decentralized Sequencer on Metis Mainnet. It aligns with a future where L2s act as public infrastructure.What is a Decentralized SequencerÂ Here is the simple idea. Ordering works better when more than one qualified operator shares the job under clear, onchain rules. If one operator slows down, others keep the flow going. Control spreads out, so no single party can hold the switch.The Metis FlowIndependent operators receive transactions in a shared queue. Public rules that weigh stake and performance select a proposer for the next block. The group checks that proposal and agrees on the same order. A signed batch with its data is then posted to Ethereum so anyone can verify and challenge if needed.This design reduces pauses when a single machine fails. It limits opportunities for selective inclusion. It gives partners, institutions, and regulators a clearer story because ordering follows open rules.How It Works in PracticeOperators stake METIS and rotate through proposer duties using BFT consensus (Tendermint style). Each batch gets signed through MPC and posted to Ethereum where anyone can verify or challenge it.Â This setup spreads ordering power across a community of stakers instead of concentrating it in one entity. The result: predictable execution, credible neutrality for institutions, and a network committed to productive security work instead of sitting idle.The Regulatory Advantage of MetisWhen one entity controls transaction ordering, regulators can classify it as an exchange. Metis avoids this by distributing control across multiple staked operators.Peirce's comments confirm what we've built: decentralized sequencing keeps L2s in the infrastructure category, not the securities regulation zone.The Broader Metis StackThe sequencer is one pillar. Andromeda strengthens the posture with the following pieces:Ethereum-Based Data Availability via EIP-4844 Blobs. Posting data to Ethereum improves transparency and auditability while keeping costs in check.Fraud Proofs. Anyone can challenge invalid state. Disputes resolve on L1 with slashing for malicious actors.MPC Signing. Multiple parties collaborate to sign transaction batches, eliminating single points of failure in the signing process.Together these parts move the network toward full decentralization with Ethereum-anchored security and practical throughput for modern applications.What is a Metis SequencerMetis sequencers are the node operators who run the decentralized infrastructure. They can:Join by staking METIS and running the required node operator software. Responsibilities are published and testable onchainEarn rewards for reliable participation and performanceRotation and consensus rules reduce ambiguity and share responsibility across several operatorsProven misbehavior can lead to penalties through slashing under the protocol's rulesTrack uptime and latency so you can improve service quality over timeGet InvolvedDecentralized sequencing is already live on our mainnet, backed by open rules and staked responsibility.If you're interested in joining the effort, submit a proposal to become a Metis sequencer on the Governance Forum. Every operator strengthens the network and shapes the future of decentralized infrastructure.Related PostTechnologyThe Dual-Network Strategy: How Metis Andromeda and Hyperion Are Reshaping Layer 2 InfrastructureCommunityCommunity Highlights: Meet the Builders Shaping Metisâ Hyperion Testnet EcosystemFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! EcosystemFrom DAO to iDAO: Governance for the AI EraAI gets smarter every month, yet control over how it learns is still concentrated. A small set of platforms decides what data goes in, who benefits from the outputs, and which values get encoded.Â People, teams, and institutions contribute the raw material that makes AI useful, but they rarely hold the keys. If alignment is about serving human intent, then the people who create the value need a direct way to govern it.We take a simple approach to implement this: put individuals first, then scale. Treat every dataset, model, and agent as an ownable, governable asset with clear provenance and programmable permissions, with governance pushed to the edge where creators set policy.The structure that makes this possible is the iDAO. iDAO will roll out on LazAI, built on Metis infrastructure.What is an iDAO?An Individual-centric DAO (iDAO) is a lightweight ownership and governance shell around your AI assets. It is the social and economic home for a dataset you curate, a model you train, or an agent you operate.Â Inside that shell, members set and update governance policies, those rules are enforced onchain. You connect to applications, and you share in the value your assets create. iDAOs turn contributions into governed property that can be trusted, reused, and rewarded.Powered by METISiDAO launches on LazAI and will be powered by Metis infrastructure. Andromeda is the production Layer 2 where iDAO activity will settle and gas is paid in METIS. While Hyperion is the high-throughput testnet for agent-heavy experiments; with transaction settlement also being in METIS.Â On this stack, DAT mints, permission updates, and reward distributions execute with gas covered in METIS, giving you verifiable records, programmable access, and a path to scale without giving up control.Integrating into the LazAI toolkitLazAI supplies the rails that make iDAOs practical. Governance changes, such as policy updates or parameter votes, are executed through the iDAO. On testnet these flows are exercised and validated, with production settlement on Andromeda. Alith is the unified access layer that lets contributors submit data, models, or agent updates. All iDAO onchain steps settle on Metis and use METIS as gas.A Verifiable Service Coordinator routes those updates to trusted validator quorums.Â Once verified, the update is anchored, the DAT reflects the new state, and future usage can share value with the iDAO that made it possible.Every step is visible onchain, which builds confidence for partners and downstream users.Aligning AI incentivesPutting assets inside iDAOs changes incentives. Contributors keep authorship and set the terms. Applications gain reliable, permissioned inputs with clear provenance.Â Communities can specialize around domains and steadily improve quality because better inputs create better models, which attract more usage and send more rewards back to the people doing the work. Alignment becomes an economic property. What iDAOs unlock in Web3 AI:Personal and domain AI that stays accurate. Provenance is built in, so context is portable and improvements compound.Clear paths to monetization. Rewards flow when assets are used, not only when they are sold.Trust at scale. Validation is transparent and tamper-resistant, which lowers the cost of cooperation across teams.Composability. iDAO assets plug into EVM tooling on Metis, so they can move across agents and apps without losing history.Get involvedIf you create data, train models, or run agents, an iDAO gives your work a home and a voice.Â  Join the conversation in the Metis Telegram, share your use case in the community forum, and follow Metis for iDAO pilot updates and release notes.Â Builders can start now by skimming the Hyperion and LazAI docs, then bringing a dataset, model, or agent into the discussion.Related PostTechnology7 Reasons to Build on MetisTechnologyWell, itâs still not âwinterâ yet!Follow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! EcosystemHyperHack 2025: Turning Ideas into RealityA New Kind of HackathonFrom May to August 2025, the Metis Foundation hosted HyperHack 2025, a long-form hackathon designed not just to build projects, but to transform them into sustainable products. Unlike the traditional 48-hour format, HyperHack provided time and structure for teams to move from ideation through development, testing, and marketing.The mission was clear:Shine a light on teams turning ideas into reality.Support builders with mentorship and guidance.Improve project quality through community input and feedback.Celebrate innovators who push boundaries and raise the bar.The journey began with more than 130 ideas in the ideation phase. By the final submission deadline, 40 projects had been completed and presented. The momentum continues with the first LazAI Quest, now live on the Hyperion Testnet, where you can test features, make your first transaction, and earn rewards.The Builderâs JourneyParticipants in HyperHack benefited from extensive community and ecosystem support:Fifteen developer workshops and weekly vibe sessions.Testing campaigns that gave real users the chance to try projects and provide feedback.The Spotlight Campaign, which helped builders gain visibility, marketing experience, and an engaged audience.The Spotlight Campaign was a standout feature, designed to give developers practical exposure to marketing and go-to-market strategies. Subsidies for campaigns, templates for outreach, and hands-on support allowed teams to experience what it means to build not only a product, but also a brand.The results spoke for themselves: StreamNFT led the way as the top performer, while Fracture Point, Safe Work Pay, BOLTIS, and LazaiTrader achieved second place recognition. Haithe, Festify, and Eduverse rounded out the third place category, proving that creativity and persistence go hand in hand.Winners of HyperHack 2025Track 1: AI-Native and Core-Aligned ProjectsLazaiTrader â $25,000Haithe â $25,000Track 2: Real-Time SystemsDogex â $25,000MetaMuse â $25,000Track 3: Infrastructure and Ecosystem ToolsHyperKit â $6,000Hyperion MCP â $6,000Alith Integration TrackEach awarded $5,000: LazaiTrader, GMÂ² Agent, Score Milk, Tweetrade Bot, Haithe, and MetaMuse.Voices from the CommunityThe winnerâs announcement event was not only about recognition; it was about hearing from the builders themselves.Score Milk demonstrated how AI can enrich gaming experiences with its interactive âMilkmanâ companion.LazaiTrader presented a strategy-driven trading tool that removes emotion from trading and leverages AI for private, data-driven insights.MetaMuse explored the idea of customizable AI companions, showcasing how users could shape agents with their own personalities and data.Dogex introduced the bold vision of high-frequency trading on-chain, a milestone previously considered unrealistic.HyperKit and Hyperion MCP focused on infrastructure, building the critical foundations that enable ecosystems to grow.Their reflections underscored the spirit of HyperHack: collaboration, creativity, and a shared commitment to making Web3 and AI more practical, accessible, and powerful.A Message from the FoundersThe Metis leadership team emphasized that HyperHack was part of a much larger mission. The foundation has evolved into a portfolio of innovations spanning blockchain, AI, and zero-knowledge technologies. Highlights include:Metis (Andromeda) and Hyperion, designed for human and AI-driven workloads.LazAI, a platform for building AI agents using secure, private data.ZKM (Xyron ZKVM), one of the fastest and most cost-efficient zero-knowledge proof systems.Goat Network, a Bitcoin Layer 2 powered by both Metis and ZKM technology.As co-founder Elena noted, Metis itself began in 2019 with zero funding. The message to participants was clear: anything is possible with persistence and vision.What Comes NextWhile the hackathon has concluded, the builder journey continues. Winners will receive their rewards following milestone reviews, ensuring that projects remain on track for real-world impact.In parallel, the LazAI Build & Chill Workshop Series offers another opportunity to learn, collaborate, and compete for a share of a $2,000 prize pool. Beyond competitions, the Metis community remains active across forums, Telegram, and Twitter, where developers, marketers, and entrepreneurs share knowledge and support one another.The next step is yours: join the first LazAI Quest on the Hyperion Testnet, explore the features, and take part in shaping the AI future.ConclusionHyperHack 2025 was more than a competition. It was a collaborative effort to turn ideas into lasting contributions for the Web3 and AI ecosystems. From innovative trading platforms to essential infrastructure, the projects demonstrated what is possible when builders are given both time and support.Congratulations to all the winners and participants. The hackathon may have ended, but the momentum it generated is just the beginning of the next chapter.Related PostCommunityMay in MetisTechnologyMetis Decentralized Sequencers Reboot: Why It Matters to the EcosystemFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! A recent Harvard essay echoes this concern about the monopolistic control of AI.Web3 projects often replicate this pattern despite decentralized branding. How AI Agents and Network Intelligence Can Scale on HyperionAI agents are quickly becoming a core part of Web3, from trading and coordination to content and onchain automation. But todayâs infrastructure isnât built for their scale. If we want agents to evolve, collaborate, and interact meaningfully onchain, we need execution layers that can support them in real time.Â Hyperion is that layer.The Problem: Infra That Canât Keep Up With AgentsFrankly speaking, most Web3 AI today is still surface-level. A Telegram bot here, a meme agent there, novel for a second or two but ultimately forgettable. Our most impactful Web3 moments are usually driven by culture: timelines, charts, memes, and collective energy. Very few of those moments have involved AI. Not yet.This is not for lack of vision however, itâs a failure of infrastructure.If we want AI agents that can react to real-time markets, coordinate across apps, and grow alongside communities, we need blockchains that can keep up. That means fast execution, flexible coordination, and enough scalability to support swarms of memory-enabled agents acting in parallel. TechnologyDeploying Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) with Alith and Phala NetworkIntroductionAs privacy and security become central to modern application design, Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) have emerged as a critical solution for secure computation. In this blog, we walk through how to build and deploy a TEE-enabled application using the Alith framework and Phala Network, leveraging Phala Cloud for production-grade deployment.This guide is based on our recent workshop where we demonstrated the step-by-step deployment of a secure, fastAPI-based TE service.What Is a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE)?A TEE is a secure area of a CPU that guarantees the code and data loaded inside to be protected with respect to confidentiality and integrity. Even privileged software such as the operating system or hypervisor cannot tamper with the code or data inside the TEE.Use cases include:Secure key managementPrivate smart contractsConfidential machine learningRemote attestation and proof generationWhy Use Alith for TEEs?Alith natively supports TEE operations including:Key derivation: Generate and manage cryptographic keys securely.Remote attestation: Generate cryptographic proofs (e.g., Intel TDX quote).Support for multiple TEE backends: Including Marlin (local testing) and Phala (production deployment).For quick iteration, developers can start with the Marlin simulator locally. But for real-world, cloud-based, confidential compute needs, Phala Network is the recommended provider.Running TEE with Phala CloudPrerequisitesDocker installed and runningA Phala Cloud account (provides $400 in free credits upon adding a payment method)Python 3.12+Alith and fastapi packagesGitHub repo: Workshop Example RepoChoosing Your TEE Provider: Why Phala (and What Else You Can Use)In our workshop, we chose Phala Network as the default TEE provider. Phala is a Web3-native project that supports trusted hardware, makes deployment straightforward via Phala Cloud, and even offers $400 in free credits upon adding a payment method (which covers most basic usage â with ~$30/month beyond that).However, Phala is not mandatory. Youâre free to choose alternative TEE backends, such as GCP or your own infrastructure, as long as they support the required TEE features and remote attestation.In fact, we encourage teams to consider:Running their own TEE infrastructure (similar to managing their own RPC nodes)Deploying our reference implementation directlyCustomizing the business logic or setup to suit their use caseð¡ Important: If your usage exceeds the Phala free tier, youâll need to cover the extra cost. Be sure to monitor this and evaluate whether your current architecture might be over-engineered for early testing.That said, itâs important to remember: LazAI is still in the testnet phase, and the current Phala free tier is generally sufficient for most basic usage scenarios. If youâre hitting usage limits early, itâs worth reviewing whether your current architecture is over-engineered for this stage.The TEE layer is critical to the LazAI network as it ensures data trust and verifiability. Clear communication of cost and flexibility is essential for builders working with this setup.Step-by-Step Walkthrough1. Clone the Repo and Set Upgit clone https://github.com/your-org/tee-workshop-demo.gitcd tee-workshop-demopython -m venv venvsource venv/bin/activatepip install -r requirements.txtâ2. Run the Local TEE Simulator (for testing)Download and unzip the simulator:wget https://github.com/Leechael/tappd-simulator/releases/download/latest/tappd_simulator.zipunzip tappd_simulator.zip./tappd_simulatorSet the environment variable:export DSTACK_SIMULATOR_ENDPOINT=/tmp/tappd.sockRun the FastAPI server:python main.pyTest endpoints locally:curl http://localhost:8000/healthcurl -X POST http://localhost:8000/te_operationsâ3. Dockerize the ApplicationBuild and tag the Docker image:docker build -t your-docker-id/allet-te-demo:1.0.0 .docker push your-docker-id/allet-te-demo:1.0.0â4. Deploy to Phala CloudCreate a docker-compose.yml like the one below:services:Â Â app:Â Â Â Â image: your-docker-id/allet-te-demo:1.0.0Â Â Â Â container_name: allet-te-demoÂ Â Â Â ports:Â Â Â Â Â Â - "8000:8000"Â Â Â Â volumes:Â Â Â Â Â Â - /var/run/tappd.sock:/var/run/tappd.sockThen go to Phala Cloud Console, paste your Docker Compose config, and click Deploy.Once deployed, test the live endpoint:curl https://your-phala-instance.phala.network:8000/healthcurl -X POST https://your-phala-instance.phala.network:8000/te_operationsWhat Happens Behind the Scenes?Hereâs how the key functions work with Alith and Phala:from alith.tee.phala import TappdClientclient = TappdClient()# Key derivationkey_result = client.derive_key("unique-id")print(key_result.key)Â  # Private key (PEM format)print(key_result.certificate_chain)Â  # Certificate# Generate TDX quotequote_result = client.tdx_quote(report_data="some-data")print(quote_result.quote)print(quote_result.event_log)SummaryBy using Alith with Phala Cloud, developers can easily:Create privacy-preserving applicationsDeploy scalable, production-ready TEEsFocus on innovation without managing low-level enclave infrastructureThis workshop showcased how fast it is to build, dockerize, and deploy TEEs using familiar Python tools and modern confidential compute backends.For more workshops and agent-building tutorials, check out our YouTube channel and stay tuned every Thursday.Related PostNo items found.Follow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! Building Verifiable Onchain AI Agents with LazAIAs decentralized AI becomes a more critical part of the blockchain ecosystem, developers are increasingly seeking ways to make AI operations transparent, verifiable, and reward-driven. In our recent live workshop, Pavel and Thiru from the LazAI team presented a deep dive into building onchain AI agents using the LazAI frameworks, focusing on data contribution, job orchestration, and secure inference execution. This blog post summarizes the core concepts, workflows, and tools covered during the session.The Need for Verifiable AITraditional AI systems are often opaque. As users, we rarely know if the model used the right data, whether the inference process was tampered with, or if results can be trusted, especially in high-stakes financial operations. LazAI addresses this trust gap by creating a verifiable AI marketplace that cryptographically registers data, distributes jobs, and confirms results through a decentralized settlement layer.Components of the LazAI SystemAgents represent the drivers of AI tasks, executing on top of foundational LLMs.Data acts as the navigational input for these agents.LLMs (Large Language Models) are the infrastructure powering AI reasoning.LazAIâs goal is to create a full-stack solution where data submission, processing, and outcome validation all happen onchain.The Architecture: Alith, LazAI Client, and HyperionAt the heart of this architecture lies Alith, a client-side framework for building AI agents. Underpinning Alith is the LazAI Client, which handles all onchain interactions, including job execution and settlement, on the Hyperion blockchain.Key Functions:Data Registration: Allows users to register training or inference data via an IPFS hash.Proof Submission: Verifies that submitted data is valid and accessible.Inference Execution: Jobs are sent to nodes, which execute the request and post results onchain.Tokenized Rewards: Contributors are compensated with DATs (Data Anchoring Tokens), ERC-1155 NFTs that represent data ownership and future royalties.Workflow OverviewThe lifecycle of a typical onchain AI task includes:Data Contribution:Encrypt and upload data.Register the data hash onchain via the LazAI client.Submit the data to IPFS (e.g., via Pinata).A job is created for data verification by nodes.Upon successful verification, a DAT is minted to the contributorâs wallet.Job Execution and Inference:A user deposits funds to a node for inference.The user sends a request to a node using a defined model and prompt.The node processes the request and submits proof of work.The smart contract verifies completion and distributes the reward.Settlement and Governance:Settlement contracts ensure fair payments to node operators.IDOWs (Independent DAOs) manage data registries and act as governing entities.Proxy contracts ensure upgradability without compromising existing registries.Code ExamplesThe session featured multiple examples, particularly using Python and Node.js. A few highlights:Registering Dataconst file = await client.addFile("encrypted_file.json");const proofRequest = await client.requestProof(file.fileId);âRunning Inferenceconst inferenceUrl = await client.getNodeUrl(nodeAddress);const result = await axios.post(`${inferenceUrl}/v1/infer`, {Â Â fileId: "74",Â Â prompt: "Translate to French"});Verifying Data onchainThe smart contract stores the file hash and verifies existence through proofs generated by nodes.Each contract (Data Registry, AI Process, Settlement) has specific functions to ensure modularity and traceability.Tooling and Developer SupportLazAI offers SDKs in:PythonNode.js(Rust examples are in progress.)The team maintains open repositories on GitHub under the 0xLazAI organization. Developers can access documentation, boilerplate code, and examples for integrating with the network.HyperHack BountyAs part of the HyperHack, participants are encouraged to build architectural diagrams and implementations using the LazAI system. The focus should be on conceptual integration rather than complete technical deployment. Projects can include:Building inference agents that consume onchain data.Designing DAO-based governance for data verification.Creating job queues for specialized AI tasks.Final ThoughtsThe LazAI framework represents a step forward in making AI computation trustless, decentralized, and fairly incentivized. By leveraging cryptographic proofs, tokenized data ownership, and modular smart contracts, developers can now build AI agents that are not only powerful but also transparent and verifiable.Watch the Full Workshop:Onchain AI Inferencing Workshop on YouTubeâRelated PostNo items found.Follow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! TechnologyThe Tech Behind Hyperionâs Parallel Processing and its Scalability Hyperion utilizes parallel processing for onchain transactions. No more bottlenecks, no more gas wars. Just fast, conflict-free execution. Chains like Sei NetworkÂ and Monad are pioneering parallel execution. Hyperion, built using Metis technology, joins this frontier as a high-throughput Layer 2 designed specifically for intelligent, scalable applications. This article explains how it works.âWhy Parallel Execution Matters âMost blockchains today still process transactions one at a time. This ensures correctness but limits throughput and responsiveness, especially during periods of high activity. Many AI agents and dApps try to minimize onchain activity, but when quick onchain reads and writes are needed, such as in games, real-time decisions or social apps, slow transactions cause real problems.Hyperion introduces parallel execution, allowing many transactions to run simultaneously. It assumes no conflicts will occur and resolves only those that do. This dramatically increases transaction capacity while maintaining correctness.Core MechanismâHyperion uses optimistic execution to speed up processing. Each transaction runs in parallel, assuming that it wonât conflict with others. This process follows 3 general steps:â1. Multiple transactions execute at the same time using available CPU cores.2. A multi-version memory system (MVMemory) tracks all versions of the state data as transactions are executed.3. Each transaction log is a read and write set, detailing exactly what parts of the state it interacted with.This approach enables high throughput without compromising safety.âConflict Detection and ResolutionâOnce all transactions have executed optimistically, the system checks for conflicts. It looks at each transactionâs read set to see if any earlier transaction modified that data.If a conflict is found, meaning a transaction reads stale data, it is re-executed with the updated state. This ensures that all dependencies are resolved correctly.The process repeats until all transactions are complete without conflict. The end result is a block of transactions that could have been processed sequentially but were instead executed in a fraction of the time.âKey ComponentsâThree main systems coordinate Hyperionâs parallel execution:Scheduler assigns transactions to worker threads and manages re-execution when needed.MVMemory maintains all state versions, helping isolate transactional effects and resolve the data each transaction should read.VmDB connects the EVM to MVMemory, intercepting reads and writes while tracking dependencies.These components ensure high-speed execution while preserving determinism and network safety.âOptimizations âHyperion improves efficiency through a set of low-level execution enhancements. It uses deferred updates for common operations like gas payments and ETH transfers, reducing unnecessary dependencies. Lock-free data structures keep CPU threads running smoothly without blocking, while pre-execution dependency graphs help predict conflicts before they occur. Transactions are also scheduled strategically to minimize overlap and re-execution. These combined optimizations increase throughput without adding complexity to the system.âDeterministic GuaranteeâEven with transactions executing in parallel, Hyperion ensures a deterministic final state. The output of any block is guaranteed to match what would result from sequential execution, by respecting the original transaction order during conflict resolution.This makes Hyperion compatible with Ethereumâs requirements and ensures consistency across all network participants.Explore the technical details of Hyperion's parallel execution architecture in the Docs.ââBuilt for AI-Optimized ScalabilityâHyperion is part of a broader trend in high-performance blockchain design but stands apart in its focus on AI scalability. Onchain AI agents benefit from low-latency environments, concurrent interactions, and high-throughput pipelines. For example, an AI trading agent on a DEX would need to read onchain prices, slippage and gas fees in real time. If this is processed too slowly the trade could fail or miss best price execution. Hyperion provides the infrastructure to support high throughput demands, making it a launchpad for real-time, intelligent applications that can scale.âSummaryâWhere Metis Andromeda focuses on production-grade deployments, Hyperion explores the outer limits of scalability and tests innovations like parallel transaction execution that are critical to supporting decentralized AI.The Hyperion Testnet is live and open to all developers. Teams are already launching agent marketplaces, AI-driven dApps, and real-time coordination tools using its infrastructure. Hyperion is more than just an L2. It is the infrastructure layer for scalable, AI-native blockchain ecosystems.If youâre building the future, build it here.Related PostTechnologyMetis Liquid Staking Blitz (LSB)EcosystemHashkey Cloud Live on Metis Mainnet, Becomes Metisâ First External Decentralized Sequencer ClientFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! TechnologyBuilding AI-Driven Trading Agents on the Hyperion Testnet DEXIntroductionAs part of the Hyperhack developer program, we hosted a live workshop introducing the Hyperion Testnet DEXâa Uniswap V2-style decentralized exchange deployed on the Hyperion Layer 2 network. The goal of the session was to demonstrate how developers can interact with this DEX, build AI-driven trading agents, and leverage Hyperionâs real-time architecture for intelligent DeFi workflows.This blog recaps the workshop, outlines the tools available, and explains how to integrate AI agents into trading applications on Hyperion.Purpose of the Hyperion Testnet DEXThe Hyperion Testnet DEX is designed to provide developers with a single unified environment for trading-related activity within the Hyperhack. Built to simulate production-like interactions, it allows participants to explore how their agents and tools can operate in real time.Key goals of the DEX include:Testing automated trading workflowsExperimenting with subgraph-based indexingIntegrating AI-driven bots using standard protocolsYou can find documentation and developer resources at Hyperion Doc.Getting Started with the DEXThe DEX is accessible at Test DEX. Upon accessing the interface, users can interact with familiar DeFi functions including:Token swapsLiquidity provision and withdrawalPool monitoringSupported token pairs currently include:METIS / USDTUSDT / WETHDAI / METISWBTC / USDTAlthough this is a testnet deployment, it mirrors Uniswap V2 mechanics, offering developers a realistic testing environment. Itâs worth noting that the absence of trading bots means price fluctuations can persist longer than in live markets, making it ideal for simulating arbitrage or strategy-driven trading scenarios.If you need test tokens to begin interacting with the DEX, you can request them via the Hyperhack Forum.Subgraph AccessTo enable data-driven applications, the DEX is backed by a GraphQL subgraph that indexes:All swap eventsLiquidity actionsToken pair configurationsFactory-level statsSubgraph URL:This subgraph allows developers and AI agents to perform granular queries, such as:Historical swaps for a token pairReal-time tracking of transaction volumePool liquidity snapshotsThis infrastructure enables deeper integration with AI agents that need to reason over market state or build predictive models.The MCP Server: A REST Interface for Agent IntegrationTo streamline agent development, weâve deployed an MCP (Meta Control Protocol) server. The MCP server acts as a lightweight RESTful wrapper over the subgraph, abstracting common queries into accessible API endpoints.Functionality includes:Fetching token and pair metadataRetrieving liquidity pool informationAccessing recent swap activityQuerying factory statsThe MCP was purpose-built to simplify integration with external services, including AI toolkits and automation platforms. It is particularly effective for use with AI agents developed using the Alith SDK or similar frameworks.AI Agent Architecture Using Hyperion DEXDuring the session, we outlined how to integrate Hyperion DEX into an AI agent workflow. The architecture includes:Tool Agent Fetches data from the MCP server (e.g., top pools by liquidity or volume).Analysis Agent Performs logic or technical analysis on the tool agentâs data to identify trading signals.Execution Agent Executes trades based on predefined strategies or outputs from the analysis phase.The result is a modular and composable AI-driven trading system capable of making autonomous decisions based on real-time DEX data.We showcased an example involving Alith agents, where:The tool agent queries the top pools.The MCP server provides this data via API.The analysis agent evaluates transaction counts and pool activity.Strategic insights are generated for trading bots or dashboards.How to Think About Onchain AIA question was raised during the session regarding how AI is integrated into the Hyperion ecosystem.While full model inference onchain remains limited by current infrastructure, Hyperion allows for AI-native architectural design, where reasoning and decision-making workflows leverage onchain data and logic.For the purposes of the Hyperhack:We are more interested in why and how AI agents should operate onchain.Participants should focus on designing architectures that justify onchain components over purely offchain approaches.Developers can combine subgraph data, AI logic, and smart contracts to demonstrate value in a decentralized, verifiable setting.AI inferencing can be done offchain while referencing onchain data indexed by the subgraph or fetched through the MCP server. This hybrid approach allows for powerful AI use cases without compromising scalability or cost.Hyperhack Ideathon: Final Days to JoinThe Hyperhack Ideathon is open until June 15, 2025. Thereâs still time to apply if you are working on an idea or want to build on Hyperion.Tracks include:AI-Native: AI workflows integrated directly into onchain systemsReal-Time: Applications that benefit from Hyperionâs low-latency, parallel executionInfrastructure & Tools: Solutions that simplify onboarding, tooling, or developer UXParticipants are encouraged to submit projects that demonstrate:Clear reasoning for building on HyperionWell-architected onchain/offchain designPractical application of real-time or AI featuresConclusionThe Hyperion Testnet DEX and supporting infrastructureâincluding the subgraph and MCP serverâprovide a robust foundation for building and testing AI-powered DeFi agents. By using these tools, developers can explore cutting-edge use cases such as autonomous trading, liquidity automation, and intelligent analysis on a performant Layer 2 network.We look forward to seeing the innovations that emerge from the Hyperhack and invite all developers to participate, ask questions, and build the future of decentralized intelligence.Related PostCommunityDecentralized Sequencer Upgrade: Phase 2TechnologyThe Tech Journey: Lower Gas Costs & Storage Layer on MetisFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! Decentralized machine learning marks a shift from centralized AI monopolies toward systems where individuals and communities can control the data, models, and incentives behind intelligent agents. Hyperion, the AI optimized Layer 2 developed by Metis, is built to support this shift. It offers a high performance foundation for running AI models onchain, where outcomes can be verified, coordinated, and owned by users themselves.A Vision of AI for the PeopleââCentralized companies that own AI data, own us,â said Natalia Ameline, Decentralization Coordinator at Metis, during her recent interview with âAll In Cryptoâ at Consensus 2025.For Natalia, Hyperion is not just a technical upgrade. It is a response to a deeper problem: centralized control over intelligence itself. She describes Hyperion as infrastructure for a new kind of internet where users govern the intelligence they interact with. That means giving individuals the tools to shape the systems that shape them.The ethos of "Decentralization Maximalism" reflects Nataliaâs vision and the original spirit of crypto. It champions open systems, user sovereignty, and public infrastructure over third-party platform control.Executing this vision includes not only deploying autonomous agents but anchoring their logic and decisions to transparent, verifiable data onchain, giving society the means to challenge, override, or improve intelligent systems rather than simply accept them.Composable AI Across Metis NetworksâThe MetisSDK is a high performance framework for building AI native blockchains. It supports Solidity, Ethereumâs Pectra upgrade, and flexible deployments. Developers can use it to launch scalable networks for onchain LLM inference, model training, and AI compute resource sharing. This SDK powers the entire Metis ecosystem, including infrastructure like MetisVM, MetisDB, and the Real Time Sequencer.Projects like Hyperion and LazAI are built on this foundation. Hyperion delivers sub second finality, AI ready contracts, and high throughput using parallel execution. LazAI adds a decentralized inference layer through the Alith agent framework, enabling verifiable and composable AI outputs. Together, they demonstrate how the MetisSDK can unlock real time, onchain artificial intelligence.Intelligence at the Execution LayerâAt the core of Hyperionâs AI readiness is MetisVM, a custom virtual machine built to support intelligent applications. It enables developers to:Run AI models directly within smart contractsVerify model inputs and outputs entirely onchainOptimize performance using AI specific opcodes and tailored execution patternsTogether, these capabilities transform the blockchain from a passive ledger into an active reasoning engine capable of inference, coordination, and verifiable automation at scale. It needs values baked into its infrastructure. With Hyperion, Metis is delivering the tools to build human aligned AI from the ground up. This is not just about ownership. It is about agency. It is about ensuring that the intelligence we create remains answerable to the people it is meant to serve.Visit the Hyperion Forum to join discussions, participate in the $200k HyperHack, and follow Metis socials to stay up to date. TechnologyBuilding the Hype: What to build on the Hyperion HyperHackMetis has just launched the HyperHack on Hyperion, a three-month hackathon aimed at showcasing the next generation of decentralized applications (dApps) that will help shape the future of the blockchain and AI ecosystem. Hyperion boasts capabilities such as on-chain AI integration, real-time parallel execution, and ultra-high throughput performance. The HyperHack will enable developers to create AI-native dApps and receive rewards once their projects reach the final stage after months of testing and feedback from the community. Metis has allocated $200,000 in developer rewards for the HyperHack campaign.Question: What Type of Project Can I Build on HyperHack?Answer:Â You can build projects that demonstrate real-life use cases for the Hyperion architecture, employing an AI-first design approach. Submissions for the HyperHack campaign are divided into three main categories:Track 1 - AI-native and Core-Aligned ProjectsTrack 1 projects are AI-native dApps where AI is embedded in the logic player or product experience. AI-powered DeFi yield optimizers that adjust DeFi earning strategies are a good project under this category. Onchain AI multiplayer games, including real-time FPS games, battle games, or adventure games, are welcome in the category, and it is even better if you can use AI to optimize the speed and efficiency of the games. Adaptive governance systems, such as AI-generated policy modelling solutions for DAOs, are welcomed in this category.Protocols and platforms that bring AI and data onchain are also in this category. A decentralized marketplace for AI models with token-based access, an app marketplace that helps users choose based on some onchain metrics, is a good example of this model. Projects that can successfully integrate Hyperion's built-in co-agent, Alith, will get extra HyperHack rewards. Alith-powered DAO vetting, Alith in-game advisor solutions, or interfaces that leverage Alithâs real-time model outputs are good examples under this category.Â Track 2 - Real-time systemsThese categories explored dApps with real-time high-throughput execution. Order books for high-frequency trading, sportsbooks with live odds calculation generation, and onchain secure communication systems also fall under this category. Real-time gaming and DeFi games with live simulation requirements and games whose incentives can change dynamically also fall under this category.Â âReal-timeâ refers to applications that necessitate low latency and high-frequency updates, which are critical for functionality and user experience.Track 3 - Infrastructure and Ecosystem ToolsThis category covers projects that advance ecosystem development, composability, and scalability. Traditional DeFi protocols that align with Hyperionâs performance capabilities are great examples. Decentralized exchanges (DEXs), lending platforms, and derivative markets with real-time liquidation mechanics also belong here. Smart wallets, transaction simulation tools, and on-chain debugging solutions are included, as well.Projects demonstrating how to bridge execution or liquidity between Hyperion and Andromeda, using MetisSDK examples, could involve asset and liquidity routing protocols across chains, developer toolkits, abstract bridging messaging, and contracts operating in both the Andromeda and MetisSDK environments.Bonus Track: Alith IntegrationProjects that integrate Alith (https://alith.lazai.network) into their codebase will receive a bonus point for the hackathon. Alith is a decentralized AI agent framework dedicated to creating an open, transparent, high-performance, secure, and inclusive AI ecosystem. Its focus on innovative AI agent development makes it ideal for the bonus track.Getting StartedTimelines and activities lined up for the Hyperion launch are available on our developer docs https://docs.metis.io/hyperionStart building on Hyperion with these easy steps:Read our introduction blog https://forum.ceg.vote/t/welcome-to-the-hyperhack-hackathon-forum/3966Read our tutorial on the Forum.https://forum.ceg.vote/t/tutorial-how-to-apply-and-submit-a-proposal/4066Complete the HyperHack application form by June 2Join the community (link)Start building on Hyperion today!Related PostCommunityMatrix RPS Badge Contest WinnerCommunityMetis TokenomicsFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! TechnologyThe Andromeda Upgrade: Increased Network Decentralization and Enhanced SecurityThe next evolution of Metis Layer 2 begins on May 14, with the activation of the Andromeda Upgradeâthe first phase of the Metis ReGenesis evolution. This milestone introduces two groundbreaking components: Fraud Proofs and Data Availability migration to Ethereum. Combined with Metis' existing decentralized sequencers, these upgrades transform Andromeda into the first truly decentralized Layer 2, delivering unmatched security, transparency, and scalability, and laying the foundation for the next era of high-performance, decentralized applications.Data Availability Migration: Strengthening the FoundationOur migration of Data Availability (DA) to Ethereum leverages the Proto-Danksharding upgrade, fundamentally transforming how Layer 2 data is secured and accessed. By posting transaction data directly to Ethereum L1 through blob transactions, we achieve several critical advantages:Enhanced Security Through EthereumThe migration ensures all transaction data inherits Ethereum's robust security guarantees. Rather than relying on external DA providers, every piece of data becomes permanently anchored to Ethereum's immutable ledger. This shift eliminates potential points of failure and strengthens the entire system's resilience.Improved Data Accessibility and VerificationWatchers and validators can now access transaction data directly from Ethereum, making fraud proof verification more efficient and transparent. This accessibility is crucial for maintaining network integrity, as it enables independent verification of all state transitions without relying on centralized data sources.Cost-Effective ScalingProto-Danksharding's blob transactions significantly reduce data posting costs, making Layer 2 transactions more economical while maintaining robust security. This efficiency doesn't come at the expense of decentralization â instead, it enhances it by making network participation more accessible.Fraud Proofs: The Guardian of Network IntegrityThe implementation of fraud proofs represents a major advancement in network security. This system enables anyone to challenge invalid transactions or state roots, creating a robust, community-driven security mechanism:Decentralized Security EnforcementBy allowing any participant to become a watcher, we distribute security responsibilities across the network. This democratization of security ensures no single entity controls the validation process, strengthening the network's resistance to manipulation.Accountable State TransitionsThe 7-day challenge window provides ample time for watchers to identify and prove fraudulent activities. When invalid states are detected, the system automatically reverts the fraudulent transactions and implements slashing penalties for malicious actors.The Power of Combined DecentralizationWhen these upgrades merge with our existing decentralized sequencers, they create an unprecedented level of decentralization in Layer 2 solutions:Complete Decentralization TriadDecentralized Sequencers: Enable distributed transaction ordering and executionEthereum-based Data Availability: Ensures transparent, accessible transaction dataCommunity-driven Fraud Proofs: Provide decentralized security enforcementThis three-pronged approach eliminates traditional centralization vectors, creating a truly trustless and decentralized Layer 2 environment. Each component reinforces the others, forming a robust and secure ecosystem that maintains high performance without compromising decentralization.Sequencer Upgrade Instructions:The Andromeda Upgrade activates key decentralization featuresâFraud Proofs and Data Availability (DA) on Ethereum. To support this, all sequencer operators must complete the following steps to prepare their infrastructure.Key Dates and Required ActionsStarting Now: Beacon API Readiness Sequencer nodes must support the Ethereum Mainnet Beacon API by the time of the upgrade. Ensure your setup includes support for the following endpoints:eth/v1/node/versioneth/v1/beacon/genesiseth/v1/config/speceth/v1/beacon/blob_sidecars/${slot}These endpoints must return valid responses when pointed to Ethereum Mainnet.May 12: Configuration Update The Metis team will publish the block height for the hardfork. Sequencer operators must:Update the Themis configuration with the hardfork block number.Restart the Themis node so the changes take effect.May 14 â Upgrade Activation On the upgrade day:Upgrade the sequencer node to the latest version released by Metis.This step finalizes the activation of both Fraud Proofs and Ethereum blob DA posting.Moving ForwardThe Andromeda Upgrade sets a new standard for Layer 2 solutions, demonstrating that true decentralization is not only possible but essential for the future of blockchain scaling. By addressing security, data availability, and transaction execution through a decentralized framework, Metis is building the foundation for the next generation of blockchain applications.This comprehensive approach to decentralization creates the perfect foundation for future innovations, particularly in high-performance applications like AI and DeFi, where security and decentralization are paramount. The Andromeda Upgrade isn't just an improvementâit's a complete reimagining of what Layer 2 solutions can achieve.Related PostCommunityLiquid Staking Token Protocols: Powering Decentralization and Economic Incentives on MetisTechnologyMETIS LAYER 2 ALPHA TESTNET HAS LAUNCHEDFollow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you! TechnologyHyperion: The First Layer 2 Bringing On-Chain LLMs to LifeThe Vision: Intelligent Blockchain ApplicationsWeâve spent years talking about the potential of AI x Blockchain.But until now, âon-chain AIâ mostly meant logging data, calling APIs, or using oracle bridges that relay AI-generated outputs from off-chain systems. It was symbolic at best, clunky at worst. Actual execution of large language model (LLM) inference on-chain, inside a blockchain-native environment, remained a pipe dream - limited by cost, performance, and architectural gaps.Imagine decentralized applications (dApps) smart enough to analyze, predict, and adapt to user needs dynamically. Blockchain technology is transformative in many ways but is also limited in processing complex AI computations efficiently on-chain. This gap prevents the full integration of AI's powerful capabilities within decentralized ecosystems, leaving many applications reliant on centralized, off-chain solutions that compromise transparency, security, and trust.We needed a new kind of L2 - AI-native, blockchain-secure, and developer-first.Today, with the launch of Hyperion's testnet, we bridge this critical gap by bringing fully functional, high-performance AI directly onto the blockchain.The Problem: Why Blockchain Needs Integrated AIBlockchain technology promises decentralization, immutability, and transparency. However, current implementations struggle with the intensive computational demands of AI models, particularly Large Language Models (LLMs). Running AI models off-chain introduces vulnerabilities and reduces transparency, contradicting blockchain's decentralized ethos. Additionally, high computational costs, slow inference speeds, and security concerns around AI integration have remained major roadblocks..The Solution: Introducing HyperionÂ Hyperion, developed with the powerful Metis SDK and LazAIâs Alith AI framework, is the first Layer 2 Ethereum-compatible solution designed explicitly for on-chain AI execution, notably supporting Large Language Models (LLMs). It combines blockchainâs decentralized trust and transparency with AI's analytical and predictive powers, delivering an unparalleled user and developer experience.In-Depth Technical Look: Hyperion's ArchitectureLetâs break down the core architecture that powers on-chain LLM execution on Hyperion.Metis SDK - The BackboneHyperion harnesses the scalability of the Metis SDK's Optimistic Rollups and Decentralized Sequencers. These technologies drastically reduce transaction costs and enhance scalability, making it feasible to execute complex AI computations on-chain without compromising performance.Optimistic rollup and decentralized sequencers design for scalabilityPrecompiled contract integration for performance-sensitive tasksDeveloper-friendly interfaces for building EVM-compatible appsAlith - The AI EngineThe Alith framework provides the core AI integration, designed from the ground up for blockchain compatibility. Using Rust-based model inference, Alith ensures high throughput and low latency for AI tasks, significantly outperforming existing solutions.Inference Engine: Optimized for low-latency execution of LLMs and other models using Rust + WASM runtimes.Workflow Coordinator: Chains AI tasks (e.g. prompt â response â action) as verifiable steps.Multi-modal Interfaces: Accepts data in various formats, enabling LLMs, computer vision models, and even structured data pipelines.On-chain Integration: Includes contracts and tooling to let devs trigger AI tasks from smart contracts, using standard call semantics.Developer Experience: Bringing On-Chain AI to LifeLetâs walk through how a dev might build with Hyperion + Alith:Write an AI Agent using Alithâs SDK. This includes model selection, inference logic, and fallback behaviors.Deploy it on-chain as a module accessible via precompiled contract logic in Hyperion.Call it from smart contracts whether it's a chatbot, a prediction engine, or a DAO assistant.Verify outputs through anchor logs, reproducible inference, or trusted enclaves.Compose outputs into other dApps e.g., LLM-generated risk profiles triggering a DeFi protocol limit switch.For example, a DAO could integrate a Hyperion-based Alith agent to summarize proposals, forecast voting outcomes, and flag anomalies - all verifiably, on-chain, and without ever leaving the trust-minimized environment.Key Features of HyperionHyperion introduces a comprehensive set of features designed specifically for efficient blockchain-AI integration:High Scalability and EfficiencyHyperion leverages Optimistic Rollups and Decentralized Sequencers from Metis SDK, ensuring rapid transaction confirmation and reduced computational overhead.Rust-Based High-Performance InferenceAlith's optimized Rust implementation enables fast, scalable, and cost-effective execution of AI tasks directly on-chain, critical for real-time decentralized AI In this weekâs Hyperion Weekly AMA, Metis CCO Daniel Kwak walked through Hyperionâs role within the ecosystem, technical differentiators, and what builders and users can expect in the months ahead.Hereâs the full breakdown for those who missed it:Why is Metis Launching Hyperion?Hyperion is not a replacement for Andromeda. Instead, it is the next phase of Metis' evolution into a multi-network ecosystem.Andromeda: Focused on traditional Web3 applicationsâDeFi, DAOs, NFTsâwith security and decentralization as primary pillars.Hyperion: Built to meet the growing demand for real-time, compute-heavy, and AI-native dApps that require faster execution, parallel processing, and flexible scaling.Hyperion is designed specifically for future-facing use cases like agent-based systems, DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Networks), real-time gaming, and high-frequency trading (HFT)âcategories that strain the performance limits of conventional Layer 2s.Core Technical Differences: Hyperion vs. AndromedaDaniel outlined the major architectural upgrades Hyperion brings:Parallel Execution: Unlike typical optimistic rollups that process transactions sequentially, Hyperion uses parallel execution to dramatically increase throughput.Real-Time Sequencer: Designed for instant finality and low-latency interactions, critical for AI and HFT applications.High-Performance Infrastructure: Modular design using the Metis SDK enables developers to eventually create custom Layer 2s or Layer 3s ("LayerX") for specialized needs.Built-In AI Inference Capabilities: Native precompiles will allow on-chain AI agent operations without depending solely on ZK proofs or centralized infrastructures.In short: Hyperion is optimized for applications that demand responsiveness and scalability far beyond what traditional L2s can offer.Shared Economy: Gas Token and Ecosystem InteroperabilityDaniel confirmed that Hyperion and Andromeda will share the same gas token â $METIS.In addition:Unified Ecosystem: Both networks are connected via the Metis SDK, ensuring fast asset flow, account abstraction, and seamless developer experience across chains.Paymasters Model: Hyperion will integrate native paymasters to allow projects to cover gas costs for users, removing onboarding friction for mainstream adoption.Projects will have options to use LST yields or protocol incentives to fund user gas, improving UX.This design ensures economic unity and developer composability across the expanding Metis ecosystem.Key Use Cases Hyperion TargetsDaniel reiterated that Hyperion is not just another general-purpose chain. It is purpose-built to unlock new possibilities in:On-chain AI Agents: Secure, verifiable agent computation natively on-chain.Real-Time GameFi: Support real-time PvP gaming, micro-payments, and AI-enhanced gameplay.DePIN Projects: Power decentralized physical infrastructure and real-time sensor data applications.HFT and Finance: Enable ultra-fast decentralized trading tools.This makes Hyperion the natural choice for builders pushing the boundaries of real-time Web3 applications.Community Q&A HighlightsKey highlights of the Q&A with community:Liquid Staking and Restaking: Metis will integrate third-party builders and protocols to offer staking and restaking infrastructure for both Andromeda and Hyperion.Data Availability Improvements: Metis is moving toward Ethereum Layer 1-based DA improvements to support even greater security and scalability.Decentralized Sequencer Network: Hyperion will leverage Metisâ decentralized sequencer approach to ensure liveness and resistance against censorship, even if individual nodes fail.Bridging and Finality: Hyperion will initially launch with Optimistic Rollup finality (7-day withdrawal period) but is exploring ZK-based finality options to accelerate cross-chain usability.Whatâs Coming NextMetis CCO, Daniel Kwak, wrapped up with a roadmap preview for the coming months:Expanded Hyperion Testnet Access: More users and builders will be onboarded soon.Developer Bootcamp: Launching in June 2025, designed to help Web2 and AI developers build dApps and agents on Hyperion.Early Contributor Rewards: Programs like the Hyperion Voyage and Builder Whitelists are already running and will expand.Mainnet Launch Timeline: Hyperion is on track for mainnet in mid-2025, following expanded testnet validation and ecosystem onboarding.Final ThoughtsThe Hyperion Weekly AMA made it clear that Metis is not just scalingâitâs evolving. CommunityComparative Analysis of AI-Blockchain Solutions: The Convergence of Two Transformative TechnologiesIntroductionThe integration of artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain technology represents one of the most significant technological convergences of the modern era. This synthesis promises to address key challenges in both domains, enhancing the decentralization, transparency, and trust of AI systems while providing blockchain platforms with intelligence, adaptability, and enhanced functionality. This research article examines five prominent AI-blockchain solutions: Metis Hyperion with LazAI, Mode, Sahara AI, NEAR AI, and Bittensor. Each platform approaches this technological marriage differently, emphasizing various aspects of the AI-blockchain relationship while solving unique problems within this emerging space.MethodologyThis analysis compares these platforms across several dimensions:Technical architecture and performance capabilitiesAI integration approachGovernance and economic modelsDevelopment environment and toolingCore value propositions and target applications1. Metis Hyperion with LazAITechnical Architecture & PerformanceMetis Hyperion distinguishes itself through its real-time execution architecture with pipeline-based transaction processing that achieves sub-second finality. Its fully parallelized state root framework enables substantially higher throughput for AI operations, while providing immediate transaction feedback that delivers Web2-like responsiveness; crucial for real-time AI applications.The platform's MetisVM offers a true AI-native execution environment with several optimizations:JIT compilation that reduces execution costs by up to 30% for complex AI operationsCustom AI-specific opcodes including floating-point operations for model inferenceIntegrated hardware acceleration support (SIMD, GPU, TPU, FPGA)Parallel execution framework with optimistic concurrency control and DAG-based dependency resolutionAI IntegrationMetis Hyperion's approach to AI integration centers on on-chain inference capabilities, featuring:Native AI coprocessor acceleration enabling on-chain model inference without prohibitive gas costsState-aware caching optimized for AI model parameter access patternsAsynchronous I/O support for large AI model data flowsMulti-VM support with seamless integration with ML frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, and ONNXzkVM integration enabling privacy-preserving AI computations through zero-knowledge proofsData & Governance FrameworkLazAI's contribution includes a robust verification framework with a four-step validation process that guarantees AI data integrity. The Data Anchoring Token (DAT) System provides tokenized AI assets with verifiable provenance and programmable access control, while an iDAO (Individual-centric DAO) framework enables community-driven AI validation.Development ExperienceHyperion is using the MetisSDK, which is a specialized toolkit designed to enhance the performance of the network, by enabling parallel transaction execution. Rather than processing transactions sequentially (one after another), the MetisSDK allows multiple transactions to be executed simultaneously, leveraging modern multi-core processors to significantly speed up block processing. The MetisSDK released with these capabilities:Performance: Significantly faster block processing by utilizing multiple CPU coresCorrectness: Despite parallel execution, results are equivalent to sequential processingExtensibility: Support for custom extensions like AI servicesFurther Optimization: Optional bytecode compilation for even greater speedValue PropositionMetis Hyperion with LazAI positions itself as the most comprehensive blockchain infrastructure for sophisticated AI applications, specifically addressing the technical challenges that have previously limited blockchain's viability for AI workloads. Its value lies in combining real-time performance, AI-native execution capabilities, verifiable data governance, and developer-friendly tools.2. ModeTechnical Architecture & PerformanceAs a Layer 2 (L2) blockchain network operating within the Optimism ecosystem (part of the "Superchain"), Mode leverages existing L2 scaling technologies. While specific performance metrics aren't detailed in the provided information, Mode cites being the "third biggest ecosystem in the Superchain," implying substantial adoption and infrastructure.AI IntegrationMode's integration of AI focuses more on application-level functionality rather than protocol-level optimizations. Key components include:An AI-secured L2 sequencer for enhanced security monitoringOnchain agent infrastructure through partnerships with Olas, Giza, and RPS AIThe Synth Subnet project on Bittensor's network for generating synthetic price path dataEconomic Model & ProductsMode is creating what it terms the "AIFi Economy", an AI-enabled financial infrastructure and interfaces designed to scale DeFi to billions of users globally. Its product suite includes:Mode Trade: A comprehensive trading platform with perpetual trading, AI integration, and synthetic asset dataAI Terminal: A text-based command interface for simplifying complex trading operationsAIFi Wallet: A consumer-facing wallet application with AI-powered capabilitiesValue PropositionMode's unique value proposition centers on creating an ecosystem where AI agents and machine learning models can execute onchain transactions across DeFi protocols. The platform envisions a financial system powered by agent-to-agent (AI2AI) interactions, making DeFi more accessible through automation and improved usability.3. Sahara AITechnical Architecture & Data GovernanceSahara AI implements a four-layer architecture:Application Layer: User interface and interaction pointsTransaction Layer: Blockchain infrastructure for provenance and transactionsData Layer: For data storage, access, and transferExecution Layer: Off-chain infrastructure supporting AI computationThe platform establishes clear ownership of AI assets (data, models, agents) with transparent attribution and compensation mechanisms for contributors.Governance & Economic ModelSahara AI employs decentralized governance through the Sahara DAO with support from the Sahara Foundation. Its economic system defines specific roles (developers, knowledge providers, consumers, validators) and implements dual growth flywheels connecting Web3 and AI ecosystems.Value PropositionSahara AI's core value proposition is democratizing AI by addressing the current concentration of AI power among few organizations. The platform emphasizes sovereignty (user control over AI assets), provenance (transparent attribution), collaboration, privacy protection, and fair compensation. Its mission is to transform AI from a centrally controlled resource to one that empowers individuals, businesses, and communities worldwide.4. NEAR AITechnical Architecture & Privacy FocusNEAR AI's technical architecture centers on privacy-preserving technology and open-source infrastructure. Key technological components include:Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) using specialized hardware (Intel CPUs and NVIDIA GPUs)Proof of Response mechanism to guarantee service liveness in decentralized systemsDecentralized Confidential Machine Learning (DCML) framework combining TEEs with payment channelsAgent Interaction and Transaction Protocol (AITP) for secure agent communicationAI Research & DevelopmentNEAR AI is building a 1.4T parameter frontier AI model (3.4x larger than Meta's Llama) using a decentralized approach with continuous competitions. The organization is also part of the Open Agents Alliance (OAA), collaborating with teams like Coinbase Onramp & AgentKit to deliver open-source AI services.Value PropositionNEAR AI's distinctive value proposition centers on "User-Owned AI", ensuring users maintain control of their data and AI interactions while making frontier AI models available in a permissionless fashion. The organization emphasizes privacy-preservation, sustainable monetization models for open-source AI, and global accessibility, aiming to provide AI services to all 5.5 billion internet users rather than just the current blockchain community.5. BittensorPeer-to-Peer Intelligence MarketUnlike the other platforms, Bittensor functions primarily as a decentralized market for machine intelligence rather than a traditional blockchain platform with AI features. Its core innovation is moving away from benchmark-based evaluation of AI toward a system where intelligence itself becomes a commodity that is mined, valued, and transacted.Technical Architecture & Network DesignIn the Bittensor network:Participants (called "peers") are neural networks that share representations across the internetPeers rank each other by measuring the value of signals they receiveA "consensus" mechanism ensures that peers must be trusted by over 50% of network stake to receive rewardsThe system incorporates bond ownership, conditional computation, and knowledge distillationValue PropositionBittensor's unique value proposition is creating an efficient market for machine intelligence through peer evaluation rather than centralized benchmarks. This approach aims to enable a more diverse ecosystem of AI systems that can find unique niches rather than competing in winner-takes-all environments. By making intelligence itself a tradable commodity, Bittensor potentially allows for more efficient production and valuation of AI capabilities.Comparative AnalysisTechnical Architecture ComparisonAI Integration ApproachConclusionThe convergence of AI and blockchain technology is still in its early phases, with each platform taking distinctive approaches to this integration. Metis Hyperion focuses on protocol-level optimizations for AI performance, with LazAI focusing on the data-alignment for AI throughÂ  through iDAO-driven governance, Mode targets DeFi applications with AI enhancements, Sahara AI emphasizes democratization and ownership, NEAR AI prioritizes privacy and user control, while Bittensor creates a marketplace for intelligence itself.These different approaches reflect the multifaceted nature of the AI-blockchain relationship and suggest that the space is still evolving toward optimal architectural patterns and business models. MetisSDK: Open-Source Infrastructure for Scalable Web3 and AI ChainsAs the Web3 ecosystem grows in complexity and ambition, so too must the infrastructure that supports it. Today, weâre excited to unveil the open-source release of the MetisSDK, the foundational toolkit powering the future of the Metis ecosystem including Andromeda, Hyperion, and LazAI.This launch isnât just a technical milestone itâs an invitation. Weâre opening the doors to developers who are curious, critical, and collaborative to help shape the next era of high-performance, modular blockchain systems.âWhat Is the MetisSDK?The MetisSDK is a chain development kit designed to enable the creation of high-performance, customizable blockchain networks with real-time execution, Ethereum compatibility, and AI-native capabilities. It abstracts the complexities of running a performant L2/L3 chain and provides the building blocks to power any decentralized applicationâfrom DeFi to AI compute marketplaces.At its core, the SDK is built on principles of modularity, infinite scalability, and a unified developer experience, making it suitable for both production-grade enterprise chains and experimental deployments by independent developers.âWhy Open Source?We believe that transparency, collaboration, and community-driven innovation are essential for building resilient and secure systems. By open-sourcing the MetisSDK, we aim to:Foster developer contributions to accelerate the SDKâs evolutionPromote code quality and security through peer review and open collaborationLower the barrier to entry for projects building on or alongside MetisDrive adoption through real-world experimentation, iteration, and feedbackThe codebase is live and publicly accessible on GitHub: ð github.com/MetisProtocol/metis-sdkWe encourage developers to explore, contribute, and help shape the future of modular blockchain networks.âA Closer Look: MetisSDKâs Tech StackMetisSDK provides a full-stack development environment with tightly integrated components that ensure reliability, speed, and scalability:â1. MetisVMA high-performance, Ethereum-compatible virtual machineSupports AI-specific execution logic and traditional smart contractsFeatures JIT/AOT compilation, opcode optimization, and execution poolingâ2. Real-Time Sequencer NodesLow-latency block finality and high throughputSupports both centralized and decentralized deploymentsDesigned for horizontal scaling with infinite chain throughput potentialâ5. Modular Chain DeploymentDeploy custom Layer 2s, Layer 3s, or application-specific chainsChains can be tailored for AI, gaming, DeFi, or enterprise use casesNative interoperability via the Metis Shared Bridge and account abstractionâWhat Can You Build with MetisSDK?MetisSDK is already powering our three core networks:Andromeda â Our flagship L2 mainnet, known for its performance and low-cost EVM executionHyperion â A next-gen L2 chain built for real-time parallel execution with AI-first supportLazAI â A purpose-built AI blockchain featuring decentralized inference, model training, and alignment frameworksBut weâre just getting started.With MetisSDK, developers can now:Deploy AI-native chains with built-in model execution supportLaunch high-throughput DeFi chains with custom sequencer configsBuild gaming or zk-Rollup testnets with low-latency responsivenessExperiment with hybrid consensus models or test new VM designsâUnified LiquidityDespite the presence of multiple chains within the ecosystem, Metis ensures liquidity remains unified and fluid thanks to its Instant Interoperability Module. This module enables seamless, real-time cross-chain swaps, allowing users and dApps to interact across chains without the need to manually bridge or split liquidity. Through this instant interoperability, liquidity pools on one chain can serve demand on another, effectively consolidating fragmented assets into a single liquidity layer. As a result, Metis becomes a liquidity hub, facilitating capital efficiency, minimizing slippage, and enhancing the user experience across the entire ecosystem.âGet Involved: Contribute to the MetisSDKWeâre calling on developers, researchers, and Web3 builders to contribute to MetisSDK and help advance the state of blockchain scalability and real-time computing.âHereâs how to get started:Explore the code: MetisSDK GitHubTackle an open issue: Check the repo for good first issues, bugs, and feature requestsJoin the conversation: Connect with our team and community in the Metis DiscordOpen a pull request: All contributions are reviewed by core developers and merged after testingSubmit proposals: Help define the roadmap by submitting ideas, RFCs, and experimental modulesMetis provides guidance and feedback throughout the development process. If you have questions or ideas, we want to hear from you.âBuilt on the Shoulders of GiantsMetisSDK leverages best-in-class tooling from across the Ethereum and Rust ecosystem:Alloy â Foundational Rust libraries for EVM compatibilityReth â High-performance modular Ethereum client in RustRevm & Revmc â Rust-based EVM with JIT/AOT supportPevm â Parallel EVM implementation used in our execution frameworkWeâre deeply grateful for the work of these projects and aim to contribute back through interoperability, documentation, and performance enhancements.âLooking Ahead: Whatâs Next for MetisSDK?We have an ambitious roadmap for 2025 and beyond:ZK & Hybrid Rollups â Support for alternative rollup types and one-click deploymentsRestaking Protocols â Shared security via Ethereum validatorsDeveloper Tooling â Advanced RPCs, node dashboards, custom compilers, and observability toolingSecurity Councils & Governance â On-chain upgradability with community-elected governanceAI Tooling Layer â Model verification, encrypted compute, and inference marketplaces via LazAIWe are preparing for the future of decentralized computationâand MetisSDK is how we get there.âFinal ThoughtsMetisSDK is more than a software toolkit; it's a blueprint for building the next generation of blockchain infrastructure. Whether you're a researcher exploring parallel EVMs, a startup launching an AI inference chain, or a DeFi team scaling your protocol with custom L2s, the SDK gives you the tools to build, experiment, and deploy with confidence.We're excited to see what the community builds next. Dive into the code, join the movement, and help us shape the future of the decentralized web.Start contributing today: ð https://github.com/MetisProtocol/metis-sdkTogether, letâs build the infrastructure for Web3 and AI at scale.âRelated PostNo items found.Follow us onSubscribe to NewsletterThank you!
